20101231180417.000|20101231180419.000|TR0|WHITFIELD:  New Year's, you know what that 
20101231180419.000|20101231180421.000|TR0|means.  People go out and they party and, 
20101231180421.000|20101231180424.000|TR0|they have a good time.  Maybe they drink a 
20101231180424.000|20101231180426.000|TR0|little bit too much.  Well, now thousands 
20101231180426.000|20101231180428.000|TR0|of Americans will be starting the new year 
20101231180428.000|20101231180430.000|TR0|in jail because of drunk driving.  
20101231180430.000|20101231180433.000|TR0|Thousands more will be hurt in drunken 
20101231180433.000|20101231180435.000|TR0|driving accidents, and dozens will be 
20101231180435.000|20101231180437.000|TR0|killed.
20101231180437.000|20101231180439.000|TR0|
20101231180439.000|20101231180442.000|TR0|So, every year police around the country 
20101231180442.000|20101231180444.000|TR0|look for new and better ways to keep the 
20101231180444.000|20101231180446.000|TR0|roads safe, and one idea that's, actually, 
20101231180446.000|20101231180448.000|TR0|catching on is the no refusal checkpoint.  
20101231180448.000|20101231180451.000|TR0|That's where police stop everybody for 
20101231180451.000|20101231180453.000|TR0|breathalyzer tests and arrest anybody who 
20101231180453.000|20101231180455.000|TR0|blows above .08 percent. That's the 
20101231180455.000|20101231180457.000|TR0|nationwide legal limit for alcohol in a 
20101231180457.000|20101231180500.000|TR0|driver's bloodstream.  Drivers can refuse, 
20101231180500.000|20101231180502.000|TR0|but in many states, automatic penalties 
20101231180502.000|20101231180504.000|TR0|kick in.
20101231180504.000|20101231180506.000|TR0|
20101231180506.000|20101231180508.000|TR0|And, now, in several states, police have a 
20101231180508.000|20101231180511.000|TR0|fall back.  If drivers won't give their 
20101231180511.000|20101231180513.000|TR0|breath, police take their blood on the 
20101231180513.000|20101231180515.000|TR0|spot.  Armed with a warrant from a judge 
20101231180515.000|20101231180517.000|TR0|who is on duty right there at the 
20101231180517.000|20101231180520.000|TR0|checkpoint.  It's being done, or tried, in 
20101231180520.000|20101231180522.000|TR0|cities and towns from Arizona to Delaware, 
20101231180522.000|20101231180524.000|TR0|with a federal government's blessing.
20101231180524.000|20101231180526.000|TR0|
20101231180526.000|20101231180529.000|TR0|Mothers against drunk driving called it a 
20101231180529.000|20101231180531.000|TR0|great deterrent.  So, no rational person 
20101231180531.000|20101231180533.000|TR0|would deny that stopping drunken driving 
20101231180533.000|20101231180535.000|TR0|is a noble ambition.  But no-refusal 
20101231180535.000|20101231180538.000|TR0|checkpoints may face a constitutional road 
20101231180538.000|20101231180540.000|TR0|block.  For Two At The Top, we turn to 
20101231180540.000|20101231180542.000|TR0|Civil Rights Attorney Avery Friedman and

20101231180627.000|20101231180629.000|TR0|going to be problematic because, again, 
20101231180629.000|20101231180631.000|TR0|we're dealing with a body invasion.
20101231180631.000|20101231180633.000|TR0|

20101231180636.000|20101231180638.000|TR0|but the difficulty is that the system 
20101231180638.000|20101231180640.000|TR0|presumes the guilt of the suspect, of the 
20101231180640.000|20101231180642.000|TR0|defendant, in all of these programs, they 
20101231180642.000|20101231180645.000|TR0|may have a judge there on the scene, but 
20101231180645.000|20101231180647.000|TR0|you know what?  They don't have a defense 
20101231180647.000|20101231180649.000|TR0|lawyer on the scene to protect the rights 
20101231180649.000|20101231180651.000|TR0|of the suspects.  And that's what may 
20101231180651.000|20101231180654.000|TR0|create the legal, the constitutional, 
20101231180654.000|20101231180656.000|TR0|issue presented here.
20101231180656.000|20101231180658.000|TR0|
20101231180658.000|20101231180700.000|TR0|WHITFIELD:  So, then the suspect who says,

20101231180705.000|20101231180707.000|TR0|test, what kind of recourse does that 
20101231180707.000|20101231180709.000|TR0|person have even though the judge is right 
20101231180709.000|20101231180711.000|TR0|there, because their defense will be, I 
20101231180711.000|20101231180714.000|TR0|don't have an attorney present.  Is that 
20101231180714.000|20101231180716.000|TR0|enough?
20101231180716.000|20101231180718.000|TR0|
20101231180718.000|20101231180720.000|TR0|FRIEDMAN:  Yes.  And the fact is if 
20101231180720.000|20101231180723.000|TR0|there's an argument that it is - it is an 
20101231180723.000|20101231180725.000|TR0|unreasonable search and seizure in a 
20101231180725.000|20101231180727.000|TR0|normal legal proceeding, when a judge 
20101231180727.000|20101231180729.000|TR0|enters an order, there is a right to an 
20101231180729.000|20101231180732.000|TR0|immediate appeal, under certain 
20101231180732.000|20101231180734.000|TR0|circumstances.
20101231180734.000|20101231180736.000|TR0|
20101231180736.000|20101231180738.000|TR0|Well, under the new setup where there's a 
20101231180738.000|20101231180741.000|TR0|no refusal policy, who protects the 
20101231180741.000|20101231180743.000|TR0|individual, who may very well not be 
20101231180743.000|20101231180745.000|TR0|guilty, and he's presumed to be not 
20101231180745.000|20101231180747.000|TR0|guilty, who is protecting the rights of 
20101231180747.000|20101231180749.000|TR0|that individual?  The idea of what's going 
20101231180749.000|20101231180752.000|TR0|on here, Fredericka, is unassailable, the 
20101231180752.000|20101231180754.000|TR0|idea that we do have a problem with drunk 
20101231180754.000|20101231180756.000|TR0|driving.
20101231180756.000|20101231180758.000|TR0|
20101231180758.000|20101231180801.000|TR0|But the bottom line is that it needs to be 
20101231180801.000|20101231180803.000|TR0|refined to make sure, not only are the 
20101231180803.000|20101231180805.000|TR0|interests of the state protected, but the 
20101231180805.000|20101231180807.000|TR0|individual's rights of the presumption of 
20101231180807.000|20101231180810.000|TR0|innocence, also, must also be protected, 
20101231180810.000|20101231180812.000|TR0|and the system does not build that in.
20101231180812.000|20101231180814.000|TR0|
20101231180814.000|20101231180816.000|TR0|WHITFIELD:  So, it continues to be a real 
20101231180816.000|20101231180819.000|TR0|striking of the balance, a difficult 
20101231180819.000|20101231180821.000|TR0|striking of the balance between those, the 
20101231180821.000|20101231180823.000|TR0|privilege to drive, and the safety of 
20101231180823.000|20101231180825.000|TR0|others who are, also, on the road.
20101231180825.000|20101231180828.000|TR0|
20101231180828.000|20101231180830.000|TR0|FRIEDMAN:  That's exactly right.  You 
20101231180830.000|20101231180832.000|TR0|nailed the issue.  It is a balancing test. 
20101231180832.000|20101231180834.000|TR0| And these experiments of no refusal 
20101231180834.000|20101231180836.000|TR0|really recognize the pervasive problem of 
20101231180836.000|20101231180839.000|TR0|the abuse of alcohol, but the system 
20101231180839.000|20101231180841.000|TR0|hasn't balanced in the rights of the 
20101231180841.000|20101231180843.000|TR0|individuals, who are entitled to be 
20101231180843.000|20101231180845.000|TR0|protected, hopefully, no refusal will also 
20101231180845.000|20101231180848.000|TR0|build in the rights of those individuals.  
20101231180848.000|20101231180850.000|TR0|We're not there yet, but, ultimately, I 
20101231180850.000|20101231180852.000|TR0|think that's what we're looking for here.

20101231180919.000|20101231180921.000|TR0|last word on Billy The Kid, at least for 
20101231180921.000|20101231180923.000|TR0|now.  And that word is, well, I'll let you 
20101231180923.000|20101231180926.000|TR0|hear it straight from the outgoing 
20101231180926.000|20101231180928.000|TR0|governor of New Mexico, Bill Richardson.
20101231180928.000|20101231180930.000|TR0|
20101231180930.000|20101231180932.000|TR0|He spent his last week in office deciding 
20101231180932.000|20101231180935.000|TR0|whether to pardon the legendary wild west 
20101231180935.000|20101231180937.000|TR0|outlaw for the 1878 murder of a sheriff 
20101231180937.000|20101231180939.000|TR0|named William Brady.
20101231180939.000|20101231180941.000|TR0|
20101231180941.000|20101231180944.000|TR0|The issue for Richardson wasn't guilt or 
20101231180944.000|20101231180946.000|TR0|innocence but a promise supposedly made by 
20101231180946.000|20101231180948.000|TR0|the governor, back in the day, to throw 
20101231180948.000|20101231180950.000|TR0|out the charges if the kid testified in 
20101231180950.000|20101231180953.000|TR0|another case.  Well, he did but was tried 
20101231180953.000|20101231180955.000|TR0|and convicted anyway.  Later, he broke out

20101231180957.000|20101231180959.000|TR0|process.  Here, now, is governor 
20101231180959.000|20101231181001.000|TR0|Richardson's decision, delivered this 
20101231181001.000|20101231181004.000|TR0|morning, on network television.

20101231181006.000|20101231181008.000|TR0|(BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)
20101231181008.000|20101231181010.000|TR0|
20101231181010.000|20101231181013.000|TR0|BILL RICHARDSON, GOVERNOR, NEW MEXICO:

20101231184042.000|20101231184044.000|TR0|here in 2010, we have a 12-foot in 
20101231184044.000|20101231184047.000|TR0|diameter ball, one that weighs 11,875 
20101231184047.000|20101231184049.000|TR0|pounds and uses over 32,000 Philips LED 
20101231184049.000|20101231184051.000|TR0|lights. Now, what's remarkable is it's 
20101231184051.000|20101231184053.000|TR0|using this LED technology, which is 88 
20101231184053.000|20101231184056.000|TR0|percent more eco-friendly.  It actually 
20101231184056.000|20101231184058.000|TR0|costs as much to power two ovens as it 
20101231184058.000|20101231184100.000|TR0|does to power the ball every single hour.
